VideoFrame.summary: The VideoFrame interface of the Web Codecs API represents a frame of a video.

VideoFrameAllocationSize.summary: The allocationSize() method of the interface returns the number of bytes required to hold the video as filtered by options passed into the method.
VideoFrameAllocationSize.returns: An integer containing the number of bytes needed to hold the frame as specified by options.

VideoFrameClone.summary: The clone() method of the interface creates a new VideoFrame object referencing the same media resource as the original.

VideoFrameClose.summary: The close() method of the interface clears all states and releases the reference to the media resource.

VideoFrameCodedHeight.summary: The codedHeight property of the interface returns the height of the VideoFrame in pixels, potentially including non-visible padding, and prior to considering potential ratio adjustments.

VideoFrameCodedRect.summary: The codedRect property of the interface returns a with the width and height matching and .

VideoFrameCodedWidth.summary: The codedWidth property of the interface returns the width of the VideoFrame in pixels, potentially including non-visible padding, and prior to considering potential ratio adjustments.

VideoFrameColorSpace.summary: The colorSpace property of the interface returns a object representing the color space of the video.

VideoFrameCopyTo.summary: The copyTo() method of the interface copies the contents of the VideoFrame to an ArrayBuffer.
VideoFrameCopyTo.returns: A Promise that resolves to the layout of the copy when the copy has completed.

VideoFrameDisplayHeight.summary: The displayHeight property of the interface returns the height of the VideoFrame after applying aspect ratio adjustments.

VideoFrameDisplayWidth.summary: The displayWidth property of the interface returns the width of the VideoFrame after applying aspect ratio adjustments.

VideoFrameDuration.summary: The duration property of the interface returns an integer indicating the duration of the video in microseconds.

VideoFrameFlip.summary: NOTE Experimental The flip property of the interface returns a boolean that indicates whether the VideoFrame is horizontally mirrored.
VideoFrameFlip.value: A boolean. If true, horizontal mirroring is applied. Defaults to false.

VideoFrameFormat.summary: The format property of the interface returns the pixel format of the VideoFrame.
VideoFrameFormat.value: A string containing a video pixel format, one of:

VideoFrameRotation.summary: NOTE Experimental The rotation property of the interface returns the rotation of the video frame.
VideoFrameRotation.value: An integer representing the rotation (0, 90, 180, or 270) in degrees clockwise. Defaults to 0. Arbitrary numbers (including negatives) are rounded to the next quarter turn.

VideoFrameTimestamp.summary: The timestamp property of the interface returns an integer indicating the timestamp of the video in microseconds.

VideoFrameVideoFrame.summary: The VideoFrame() constructor creates a new object representing a frame of a video.

VideoFrameVisibleRect.summary: The visibleRect property of the interface returns a describing the visible rectangle of pixels for this VideoFrame.
